intro: Platantheroides floribunda, commonly known as the showy lady's tresses, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, flowering stems that bear dense clusters of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. It has linear leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
